entry.title: RTC Room Optimization
entry.content:
Background

What is RTC?

Real-Time Communication (RTC) is live, instant communication in, well, real-time. That is, it happens in the very moment of need without any fuss or drama.

How does it work, you ask? It’s a collection of APIs and protocols that allow secure audio, video, and data sharing between different devices (like a mobile phone, for example). More than that, though, RTC allows players to communicate game strategy in real time.

What is RTC room?

RTC room is a forwarding container, the user’s voice will be forwarded to other users in the room, if you want to participate in voice communication, just need to join the room, turn on the microphone and speaker, then you can communicate with other people in the room.

Implementation of RTC Room

The implementation consists of two parts: client SDK and RTC service. App accesses the RTC service through the client SDK, which implements room and devices management. the RTC service implements rooms management and data forwarding. This article focuses on the client-side implementation.

Here mainly introduces the implementation of GVocie’s voice room, involving room type, room management, room protocol and so on. GVocie is a platform-cross SDK, providing voice chat related APIs, including room management, supporting Android\iOS\Windows and other Game platforms like Switch\xbox\PS.

Room Type

So far we support three types of rooms:

  1. Team Room type, one room can accommodate less than 100 users, often used in 5V5 multiplayer online battle games, like King of Honor, League of Legends.
  2. National Room type, one room can accommodate more than 1 million users, often used in large map games, like PubgM and Roblox.
  3. Range Room type, nearby players can hear each other, but not beyond a certain distance even in the same room, often used in real-time strategy games, like PubgM.

The implementation of these three types of rooms is similar. In different places, the National Room needs to set the player role, anchor or audience, only anchor role can open microphone, and the range voice needs to update the player coordinates in real time.

Room APIs

There are mainly Join-Room APIs, Quit-Room API and other functional auxiliary APIs, as below:

Room Management

Room management has two parts, room manager and room instance, room manager manages multiple room instances, every room instance has its own room state management and network sockets.

When we call Join-Room API, we create an room instance and put it into room-manager’s room map, and then network thread will drive the join-room process, after handshake with RTC service was done, room instance can send\receive voice data to\from other members in the room.

User can call Quit-Room API to leave room, and then the room instance will be remove from the room map and be destroyed after said goodbye to RTC service.

Protocol Security

RTC service is UDP protocol service, data channel is not secure, in order to avoid eavesdropping, voice data needs to be encrypted. By comparison, we choose RC4 as the encryption algorithm. RC4 is symmetric encryption and easy to implement and use. For mobile devices with high performance requirements, RC4 is the first choice.

RC4 algorithm is simple, the key length is variable, variable range of 1-256 bytes (8-2048 bits), with today’s computer performance, when the key length is 128 bits, using brute force to search the key is not feasible, Therefore, it can be predicted that the key range of RC4 can still resist the attack of brute force search key for a long time in the future.

For performance reasons, we use RC4 encryption for signaling data like joining or quiting room, and we use private data structures for raw voice data to ensure security. Moreover, we do not encrypt the signaling content, but only sign the key information of the signaling data.

Probloms about RTC Room

  • Many customers believe that RC4 key storage locally is not secure.
  • Dozens of users per week report that the voice server was not connected.
  • Hundreds of users per week report that voice chatting was unavailabe.

Optimizations of RTC room

Since 2015, every day, users have reported failure to enter their rooms, or hearing problems, especially when the boss called in the middle of the night to say he was playing a game using voice chat and couldn’t hear, it’s devastating.

Through Full-Link-QoS reporting, we analyzed BadCase one by one, found and optimized room management and complexity of service access.

Before introducing complex optimizations, let’s look at the issue of key insecurity firstly.

Optimizing key Security

The default RC4 key is hard-coded in the code, can be easily accessed by reverse technology, after got the RC4 key, an attacker can simulate a business joining-room and quiting-room operations, broadcast advertisements or eavesdrop on voice content.

The solution is to sign on the App’s server, RC4 key donot keep in the client.

The API is as follows:

Optimizing API calling

Before optimization, both user threads and network threads will read and write room instances, which may cause occasional access to released room instances or uninitialized room instances. When joining room and quiting room are performed at the same time, the room status will be abnormal, and the room instance cannot be joined or quited again.

The optimization method is to decouple the user thread and the network thread. The user thread only reads the room instance through the room manager, and the creation, destruction and write operations of the room instance are handed over to the network thread.

In addition, in order to ensure the consistency of joining and quiting results, the joining and quiting operations must be performed one by one.

In the case of stress tests, such as frequent triggering of room operations over a short period of time, it is necessary to ignore unnecessary room operations and only perform the last one, so as to ensure consistency of results and reduce unnecessary room operations.

Optimizing Network switching

Before optimization, the RTC service detects that the IP port changes during network switchover. In this case, the RTC service feedback challenge authentication. After successful authentication, the connection is restored and voice data continues to be received and sent.

If the network operators before and after the switchover are different, cross-carrier communication problems will occur and the communication quality will deteriorate. The optimization method is to reconnect. The scheduler will deliver a new access address that is consistent with the carrier network, then SDK handshakes with the new gateway, new gateway service will route voice data to the previous RTC server.

Optimizing implementation of Friend Room

There is a scene in the game: you invite your friends to play the game, you only want to communicate with your friends, don’t want to communicate with the rest of the team. so the game needs to maintain two logical rooms, friend room and team room.

Before optimization, the game only created one room, realized Friend Room by the forwarding whitelist (which teammates the uplink voice data is forwarded to) and the downlink blacklist (which teammates’ voice data is not received). The complexity of implementation is huge, you need to dynamically manage the room member ID list and friends list. The blacklist and whitelist mechanisms may cause problems, causing the voice of a non-friend to be heard or voices of some friends cannot be heard.

The optimization method is to create two rooms, one friend room and one team room. The disadvantage is that two channels of voice data are uploaded. The advantage is that the call logic is simple, and no need to maintain room members and upload whitelist and download blacklist.

Optimizing Room Instance Leaking

In order to simplify the complexity of calling API, we do not provide an interface for traversing room instances, so App need to maintain the room list by themselves. If App forget to quit unnecessary rooms, room instances will be leaked, which will lead to cross-room(Heard stranger) problems.

There are generally three reasons for room instance leakage:

  1. The operation logic of room instance was messy, which caused room instance leaked.

  2. In some extreme cases, for example, Game switched to background for a long time, which caused Network disconnect, after App switched foreground, Game had already come to the next scenario, and the room instance in the previous scenario cannot be released.

  3. Based on the second point, even if the game logic released the room instance which was disconnected already in the previous scenario, unfortunately, the disconnection and reconnection mechanism may cause the previous room to be created again.

The optimization method is to define all the scenes that using voice chat in the game. When switching scenes, quit the room of other scenes and enter the room of the new scene.

The Join-Room API needs to be modified to add scene parameter.

It is important to note that the QuitRoom API’s parameter is changed from the room name to the scene name, and this is the most important point. With this change, the game no longer has to manage the rooms, but only has to define a few scenes. The room names are different for each user, but the scenes are the same.

Taking CODM(Call Of Duty Mobile Game) as an example, friends can be invited to play the game together in the lobby, and they enter the friend room, during the battle, they also enter the team room and LBS room. After the battle is end, they will exit the team room and LBS room. At this time, the friend room still exists, they can begin the next battle.

Make a summary:

  1. To define several voice chat scenes;
  2. One scene can only have one room. If the room instance is already exists, the SDK will exit the current room instance and enter the new room.

Optimization effect

  1. RTC service cannot be connected problems decreased by about 80%~99%.
  2. Room instance leaking problems decreased by about 90%~99%.
  3. Cannot be heard problems decreased by 80%~90%.

In the past, dozens or hundreds of badcases were reported every week. Now, there are only a few cases per week.

entry.title: Improve the success rate of RSTT
entry.content:
RSTT is short for real-time-speech-to-text, ‘real-time’ means capturing and sending voice data to STT service simultaneously, there will be less delay in translation.

Background


Schedule service is a UDP service and STT-service is a HTTP(s) service. Firstly, SDK gets STT service’s address and AppID from schedule service. Secondly, SDK handshakes with STT-service and than send captured voice data to STT-service every 500ms.

Problem & Solution

P: Failed to get address of STT-service

There are many possibilities, as below:

  1. UDP socket port was blocked by firewall;
  2. UDP package was incorrectly redirected by Proxy or VPN;
  3. Incorrectly route address cache or acceleration;
  4. UDP package was lost due to network congestion or throttling;
  5. …

S: Occam’s Razor

Principle : Entities should not be multiplied unnecessarily.

Why should SDK get STT-service’s address and AppID from schedule service?

On the one hand, the original intention is that schedule service to delivery all the address as control center, but as the SDK gets more and more features, scheduler is changed frequently, witch makes it difficult to update the scheduler.

One the other hand, every game(or App) has different common vocabulary, stt service needs to be customize to impove translation accuracy, so, stt-service should be deployed separately and the address is also need to be different.

How to improve the success rate of UDP request?

  1. Resonable retry interval and handshake timeout.
  2. Try other ports, gt 10000, both client and server.
  3. Try http(s) protocol with 80/443 port.
  4. Reconect when Network was switched.
  5. The client accesses a nearby service which has high performance.

The UDP connection sucess rate cannot be increased to 100%, Is there any way to get a 100% success rate? Or is it necessary to pull STT service address from scheduler? Yes, it’s true, pulling service address from scheduler makes services easier to deploy and schedule. What if we set a default address and update it when necessary? Yes, it’s the solution! Similar to a database cache, the service always uses the cached data and the cached data will be update periodically or when writing database.

The optimized scheduling processing as below:

After the modification, even if the address update fails, the default address also ensures that the STT service is available.

P: DNS failed or DNS hijacking

If DNS is failed or DNS is hijacked, there will be no available STT service address to use, then STT will fail.

The steps for DNS resolution are as follows:

  1. Searching DNS cache of App, for example, the browser;
  2. Searching DNS cache of OS;
  3. Searching local hosts file;
  4. Searching DNS cache of router;
  5. Searching DNS cache of local network operator.


If they were all failed, DNS happened. Recursive DNS and Authoritative DNS are the most common types of DNS resolution. Here we only introduce the principle of Recursive DNS:

  1. The local DNS server sends a DNS request to the root DNS server, for example, github.com;
  2. After the root server is queried, cannot find the record from the mapping between the domain name and IP address. Then, it will tell the local DNS server to query on the TLD(Top level DNS) server, and give the address of the TLD Server(.com server);
  3. The local DNS server sends a DNS request to the TLD server;
  4. After receiving the request, the .com DNS server does not directly return the IP address corresponding to github.com. Instead, it tells the local DNS server to obtain the IP address from github.com name server, and then feedback the address of github.com name server;
  5. The local DNS server sends a DNS request to the github.com name server;
  6. After receiving the request, the github.com name server finds the mapping between the domain name and the IP address in its cache table and returns the IP address to the local DNS server;
  7. The local DNS server returns the IP address corresponding to github.com, and puts it in its cache table.


Domain name searching is led by local DNS server. Of course, local DNS server may redirect the DNS request to another operator’s DNS server for resolution. DNS resolution process is over UDP protocol, it is unsafe and lengthy, resolution process could be redirected or changed and returned a wrong address, the success rate and latency of DNS are greatly affected by the quality of local operator.

DNS Problems：

  1. Local hijacking, after the computer system is infected by Trojan or rogue software or VPN, DNS may be abnormal. Local hijacking includes hosts file tampering, DNS API Hook, SPI chain injection, and BHO plug-in.
  2. ARP Spoofing, ARP protocol was not designed for security, so it does not verify that a response to an ARP request really comes from an authorized party. It also lets hosts accept ARP responses even if they never sent out a request. This is a weak point in the ARP protocol, which opens the door to ARP spoofing attacks.
  3. DNS redirect, the attacker redirects DNS name query to a malicious DNS server. Then the resolution of the hijacked domain name is completely under the control of the attacker.
  4. DNS hijacking, DNS is over UDP protocal, not secure. By listening to the conversation between the client and the DNS server, the attacker can get the DNS query ID. The attacker sends a fake response to the client before the DNS server, thus tricking the client into visiting the malicious website.
  5. DNS poisoning, attacker injects fake entries into the DNS table of DNS server, client’s DNS resolution will return an incorrect IP address.

S: HttpDNS

The industry’s main solution is to build their own domain name resolution system, for example, 8.8.8.8 of google’s free DNS server.

My company has its own DNS resolution service, named HttpDNS. The principle of HttpDNS is as follows: The client connects to the anycast gateway through https, and the gateway connects to network operators through BGP. Therefore, DNS can be performed nearby and ensure security.

Compared with the traditional Local DNS, HttpDNS can query multiple domain names at a time through the Https protocol and returns high-quality addresses. There are no problems such as DNS redirection, hijacking, and poisoning.

Our SDK does not call the HttpDNS interface directly, Instead, we provide API and Let App do the HTTP DNS resolution for us.

With HttpDns optimization, the domain name resolution failure rate is reduced by 63% and the hijacking rate is reduced by 99%.

P: Timeout problem of weak network

Realt-time STT module sent one request per 500ms during the voice recording, STT service requires that not a single frame be lost, if the voice data is not continuous, the STT service will wait until the data arrives or the session times out.

Https is based on the TLS and TCP protocol, more security means more interaction and more packets to be sent, the latency and failure rate will be greater in the case of weak network.

The previous STT request implementation was that if some of the request were failed or timeout, never try again, as a result, STT was failed in the end. So, what if we try resend failed requests?

S: Supporting HTTP retry

The Session timeout duration of the STT service is 10 seconds. If HTTP is failed, HTTP retransmission can be performed if the time is sufficient. Retry with the same domain name may still fail, such as the domain hijacking scenario mentioned above. So, is there a better retransmission strategy?

Background on STT services

  1. STT service supports IP direct connection;
  2. STT service supports HTTP and HTTPS;
  3. The STT service supports frame de-duplication and allows the same frame to be sent repeatedly;
  4. STT service supports connection detection, which can verify whether the STT domain name or IP is available (via handshake authentication);
  5. APP client supports HttpDns, which can help resolve the STT domain name and obtain the IP list after resolution;
  6. APP client support HTTP and HTTPS, has been configured to support HTTP protocol.

Implementation of STT request retries

  1. Client call SetRSTTServerInfo API to set the STT domain name, AppID of STT, and IP list resolved by HttpDns;
  2. STT domain name detection, verify the availability of http://ip/url, https://ip/url, http://domain/url, https://domain/url;
  3. If https address https://domain/url is failed,
  4. Use the addresses obtained by 2) to try again, the priority is ip > domain and http > https, until the retransmission succeeds, or the retry times reaches the upper limit, or times out, or all available addresses are retried.
  5. If retry succeeds, retry address is better, and the rest of requests of this session will be sent using this address firstly;
  6. If retry fails, STT ends in failure.

The following diagram shows that after https://domain/url fails, an attempt to use http://ip/url.

The efficiency of sending requests by a single thread on weak network is poor, Since STT service supports receiving multiple requests simultaneously, I refactored the STT session to support multi-threads, to reduce the delay and increase the success rate of retry.

Results

Billions of STT requests happened every day, after the above optimizations, RSTT’s latency dropped from 650ms to 320ms, The failure rate dropped from 0.8% to 0.25%, BadCase feedback is down 80%.

Future plans

  1. STT is a multimedia service, UDP is more suitable. A moderate amount of packet loss is allowed, 40ms instead of 500ms per request, PLC/FEC/ARQ can be done at the back end to reduce the impact of packet loss.
  2. QUIC(http3.0),QUIC is a new multiplexed transport built on top of UDP. HTTP/3 is designed to take advantage of QUIC’s features, including lack of Head-Of-Line blocking between streams.
  • QUIC is a reliable protocol, on a weak network, the performance is lower than that of UDP, which allows packet loss.
  • STT service gateway needs to be modified to support QUIC, support is needed at the company level.
  • SDK needs to integrate QUIC plug-in, which is 1MB size, too large for our SDK, hopefully all platforms of OS will support QUIC in the future.

entry.title: Reduce code zize
entry.content:
Why should reduce code size?

  1. Size limit from distribution platform, for example, Googel Play, apk limit size is 100MB.
  2. Improve program performance, lower memory and disk usage.
  3. Reduce costs of customer acquisition, smaller app size, higher the user conversion rate.

How to reduce code size?

This article descriptes how to reduce size of android dynamic library and iOS link-map.

Packaging on depends

Your app or SDK has a lot of functions, customers only need some of these features, packaging app/SDK as needed is necessary. Like most open source projects, configuration file determines which modules need to be compiled and linked. Module boundaries must be clear, code must be low coupled. Here show how to configure porject file:
iOS: https://github.com/kronenthaler/mod-pbxproj, .pch file is easy way to define macro.
Android: Application.mk, https://developer.android.com/ndk/guides/application_mk, APP_xxx is more convenient compared to LOCAL_XXX.
Windows: https://github.com/marktsuchida/vcxproj-stream-editor, vcxproj is xml file, you can use python script to parse and replace.

For example,

–gc-section

gc-section,the operation of eliminating the unused code and data from the final executable is directly performed by the linker.

Clipping symbols exported

–exclude-libs make all symbols in static library not exported. if you want to customize the export symbol table, version script is helpful.

LTO(Link-time optimize)

The basic principle behind LTO is that some optimization passes are pushed back to the linking stage. Why the linking stage? Because that is the point in the pipeline where the entire program (i.e. the whole set of compilation units) is available at once and thus optimizations across compilation unit boundaries become possible.

After LTO enabled, smaller code size and higher performance. But, slower link speed and poorer debug ability.

Exception\RTTI\-Oz

C++ lauguage supports exception and RTTI(Runtime Type Identification), if your project does’t use them, please disable them.

Code Generation Options,
-O0: no optimization, generates the most debuggable code.
-O1: Somewhere between -O0 and -O2.
-O2: Moderate level of optimization which enables most optimizations.
…
-Os Like -O2 with extra optimizations to reduce code size.
-Oz Like -Os (and thus -O2), but reduces code size further.

-Oz generate smaller code size that -Os, but slight and acceptable performance penalty. If -Oz is set, need to do adequate performance test.

Resuorces

The resources the code depending on can be download from remote server or CDN, therefor, Digging resources out of code can also reduce code size. For example, Algorithm Model and String.

Stripping log strings as example, here is the steps:
Firstly, Using python script to strip log string from code before compiling, save the striped strings as a resource file,refer to Appendix.
And secondly, After SDK or module is loaded, try to load string resource file from local disk, if it is not exist, download it from remote.

The benefits:

  1. Size of the code is reduced;
  2. Not all the businesses need print log;
  3. More secure, logs is an important way to reverse engineering;
  4. More easier to achieve internationalization.

The code of logging before string stripping:

The code of logging after string stripping:

The resource file of the string, rc4 encryption.

Lightweight implementation

  1. Avoid using C++ STL, expecially std::ostringstream;
  2. C language open source has a higher priority, cJson/protobuf-c/… rather than rapidjson/protobuf-c++/…;
  3. Call directly, donot overwrap, open source like ffmpeg/webrtc are too huge, Donot use an ox-cleaver to kill a chicken.

Data serialization for example, protobuf is used a lot, code size has two parts, one part is library, another part is generated cpp proto files.

If your project doesn’t using reflection, protobuf-lite is better chooise.

With protobuf-lite, Code size is significantly reduced, especially libarary size, the point is not to change your code. If your project has a amount of proto files, protobuf-c is better chooise.

Optimization Results

After optimizations by the above methods, Android Arm64 dynamic library(.so)’size of Our SDK was reduced from 10MB to 1.8MB, the same with iOS app’s linkmap. Packaging related SDK modules according to App needs prevents SDK size from getting bigger and bigger.

Appendix

entry.title: Thread dead loop -- auto variable
entry.content:
When I was a student many years ago, the teacher described the difference between auto variables and volatile variables in detail. At that time, I thought it was just two keywords of C language, which were rarely used, so I didn’t pay much attention to them. With more and more work experience, I realized that these two ordinary guys have a lot of articles, and their existence means a contest between program performance and reliability.

Problem backgourd

I am work at the multimedia department of a well-known internet company (BAT) since 2015. Our product is a voice-chat cross-platform SDK, serving hundreds of millions of users.

Recently I found a strange problem, many users feedback that cannot open the microphone occasionally, team members cannot hear his voice, but he can hear team members’ voice.

Allow me to introduce the steps to using voice-chat function:

Problem analysis

Cannot-Hearing is a common problem in RTC-over-voice application. In 2019, I designed a Full-link QoS system to locate the cause of these probloms. The idea is as below:

Through the Full-link QoS system, I located that the event of opening micphone was not processed by work thread, and the tick count of work thread is 0. so, was the work thread blocked or dead? This problom is set aside until opening LTO to optimize package size, aha, it was occurred again.

I dumped the thread call stack, found that the work thread run into loop code and cannot jump out. loop condition is a globle auto variable.

We known that thread sleeping will causes cache invalid. CPU cache will be update after next thread tick when initialize complete. The bad news is SysSleep function is empty implementation under Android platform, causes the cpu that assiciated work thead to run at 100%.

So, Why does this problem occur at low frequencies, but it inevitably happens when LTO is enabled? usually, user thread sets bEngineStart to ture firstly, and then work thread jumps over the loop code. But, if user thread is blocked a short time(Enalbe LTO), work thread has start up firstly, and bEngineStart is still false, although user thread will set it to true later, but work thread has no chance to update it from memory.

Therefore, user thread blocking and multiple threads switching will cause the above problem.

Solution

SysSleep is an old version of thread sleeping implementation, new version Sleep function implementation is platform-wide, replace it with the new verion!

Of course, volatile variable can also solve this problem, for example:

The result of above program in debug mode:

The usual result in release mode:

The rare result in release mode:

Assembly code in debug mode:

Assembly code in release mode:

“++nTick;” code is ignored in release mode, and while loop gonna to be dead loop if bRun is false at first, this is the compiler’s optimization behavior, bRun‘s writing operation in user thread is invisible to work thread, compiler instruction reordering happends in release mode(-O2 optimization).

Variable declared as volatile:

The result in release mode:

Assembly code of volatile version in release mode:

Some attributes of volatile variable:

After variable is declared as volatile, everything is fine!

Are there other ways to forbid instruction reordering? Yes, compiler barriers is designed for this purpose.

1.Explicit compiler barriers.

MemoryBarrier refer to MSDN.

2.Implied compiler barriers.

Non-inline functions act as barriers.

entry.title: Trace Code Of C++
entry.content:
As a popular App, there will be many users feedback badcases, As a software engineer, it is your responsibility to locat the cause of the problem quickly and effectively.

Background

I am now maintaining an RTC voice SDK in a well-known internet company (BAT), which has a billion users. Needless to say, there is a lot of feedback online every day. There are several types of questions that have a relatively large number of feedback, As below:

  1. Cannot hear or be heard problems;
  2. Connect server failed problems;
  3. STT(Speech To text) translation failed problems.

The implementation of one function involves many module calls, for example, real-time communication via voice, involving operations of equipment, DSP data processing, network, and data forwarding. Any problem in any link will result in no sound problem.

Quickly locating problems from complex systems requires long-term accumulation of experience, some problems are difficult to locate by experience. We need a way of locating online problems in lieu of experience, we have tried many ways, for example, reporting logs and QoS data.

On the one hand, not all apps can implement log reporting, on the another hand, analyzing logs requires experience, therefore, locating problems through logs is inefficient. We report a small amount of QoS data, which cannot cover most business scenarios (these data are for statistical use). Therefore, online problems cannot be located through existing QoS data.

Industry Solution

By chance, I came into contact with the concept of microservices and learned about the advantages and disadvantages of microservices. For example, the split services are more independent, but the more services are, the more difficult it is to maintain. OpenTracing is a tracking system, we can track business calls in the whole linked services.

OpenTracing wants to form a common language around what a trace is and how to instrument them in our applications. In OpenTracing, a trace is a directed acyclic graph of Spans with References that may look like this (from their website):

opentracing-cpp is a very good open source project, but in the end I didn’t use this open source project. It’s wiki as below:

On the one hand, it does not use the thread’s Thread Local Storage to store the tracing of the current thread, but uses the function parameter to pass the tracing, which is intrusive to the code. On the anothor hand, it has no timeout mechanism, no syntactic sugar, and tracing metadata is too simple.

Our Solution

We refer to the implementation of OpenTracing, this tracking mechanism is also applicable to the call tracking in the SDK of C++.

Taking API tracing as an example, we trace the call stack of API, which includes asynchronous calls, such as cross-thread calls and cross-process calls.

Then, we send the collected tracing data to the Collector gateway, and finally saved in the data platform. With these tracing data, we can query the tracing records about badcase via key words(AppID and OpenID) and analyze the abnormal points.

It’s not just API calls that affect functionality, but also the pipelines that process data inside the engine. Taking RTC as an example, if we can trace the status of all related APIs and all nodes of the pipelines, we have the ability to locate the cause of the exception.

We have optimized asynchronous calls to make Tracing easier to use, more transparent, and minimally intrusive to the code.

Thread asynchronous call:

Process asynchronous call:

In order to reduce the amount of QoS data, we do data merging and report according to the strategy of cloud-control.

Merge all Spans of Tracing, one trace and one packet instead of one span and one packet.

When the program is stable enough, it is not necessary to report the full amount of tracing data every day(the amount of data is massive, and the QoS data collector needs thousands of servers), just open the tracing of relevant APIs and pipeline nodes for bad cases.

Effects

After Tracing system goes online, the effect is obvious, and more than 90% of online problems can be located within half an hour. It plays an important role in optimizing the success rate of connecting to the server, optimizing the success rate of STT, and locating the problem that cannot hear problems of RTC.
